content: @Tim Abbott & other people who are affiliated with Recurse Center -- in the Never Graduate Week stream there, people have just started talking about what Zulip changes (socially or technically) could help the RC alumni community.
@Sumana Harihareswara I assume the stream is private? Can you share/summarize if anything is relevant to the mobile app?
Yeah, I'm also curious to hear what we do on the web-app side of things.
It's in the RC Zulip instance, which isn't open to the public. Which is why there's a heads-up here for me to subscribe :)
Looks like no actual thoughts yet, just someone proposing thoughts :)
Does RC have a public stream? Is it not possible to get an account if one is not a RC fellow? (why: I want to test to create Zulip-RC tunnel)
No, but if you want another org to test a tunnel with, there are some other public ones around.
I suppose I won't be able to find out unless I ask. They are hard to discover.
On the contrary, Riot.im has a directory listing of project/group rooms.
We should probably figure out a place in our docs/website to let people list them.
How about docs/public-zulip-instance.md?
Opened #6767 kind of like list of vpn/minecraft servers :P

We should probably not include active users as it would be very hard to maintain. I think we can have a description of the instance instead. Also do you think it would be better to list them in a markdown table?

I'm adding the snapshotted active user (with the timestamp as of today, which can updated as often or as infrequent as necessary). Agreed for adding the instance description. As with table formatting, I think it is used only when there are at least 4 columns?
I suggested table because I thought it may look good :)
https://github.com/rht/zulip/blob/public-server/docs/public-zulip-servers.md ?
I would probably link to the organization's own website as well.
And maybe also have a way to list well-known organizations that are using Zulip but don't have a public server.

From the front page, orgs with invite-only realm:
- Akamai, https://www.akamai.com, ?
- Doctor On Demand, https://www.doctorondemand.com, ?
- LevelUp, https://www.thelevelup.com, ?
- Recurse Center, https://www.recurse.com, https://recurse.zulipchat.com
- Panjiva, https://panjiva.com, https://panjiva.zulipchat.com
- Solano Labs, https://www.solanolabs.com, https://solanolabs.zulipchat.com
- Veelo, https://veeloinc.com/, ?
- Cambridge Mobile Telematics, https://www.cmtelematics.com, ?
- [not at the front page] Clear Code, https://www.clear-code.com/, https://zulip.clear-code.com

Surely this is just the tip of the iceberg?

That's actually a decent subset of the big realms that we know about (and help host, in many cases). We haven't marketed Zulip very aggressively yet (by design) in its open source era, so a lot of the installations actually date back to our closed-source beta days. Of course, it's very difficult to estimate how many self-hosted installations are out there.
Actually, I'm aware of a lot more large realms that host themselves than that list :).
Are we sure firms and/or public realms would want to be announced like this on a webpage? I feel like we should make the list opt-in if we make it.
We definitely want to make such a list opt-in.

We haven't marketed Zulip very aggressively yet (by design) in its open source era, so a lot of the installations actually date back to our closed-source beta days.

We definitely want to make such a list opt-in.

Has EFF consented?
The EFF has not yet decided what they are using
Resurfacing this topic.
@Rein Zustand we're going to work on this when we have time; I don't think there's a meaningful way you can help with it.
